dialogue: Doctor: Is the edge of the spot well-defined or does it look irregular?
Patient: The edge of the spot looks irregular.
Doctor: Does the area have any redness or is it predominantly dark or pale?
Patient: The area is predominantly dark, with some redness around the edges of the growths.
Doctor: Where on your body do you notice this spot?
Patient: I noticed this spot on my forehead.
Doctor: How does the texture of the area feel compared to the rest of your skin?
Patient: The texture of the area feels rougher and more uneven compared to the rest of my skin.
Doctor: Are there any symptoms associated with this area, such as itching or burning?
Patient: I have noticed some itching around this area, but no burning sensation.
Doctor: Do you have other spots like this on your body?
Patient: Yes, I have a few other spots that look similar to this one. They are scattered across my body, but mostly on my arms and legs.
Doctor: How often do you notice this spot?
Patient: I notice this spot quite often, especially when I'm outside in the sun.
Doctor: Could you describe the shape and size of the spot?
Patient: The spot is irregular in shape, somewhat oval, and it's quite large compared to the surrounding skin.
